title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Wednesday, 28 October 2015 - BBC News
summary: an inquest into the death of an aylesbury man who was murdered in south africa has concluded he was `` unlawfully killed '' .
a meeting is due to take place today between bedfordshire 's mps and policing minister mike penning over funding for the county 's police force .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for beds , herts and bucks have finished for today .
join us again tomorrow from 08:00 for all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the three counties .

documents.title: weather : dry but cloudy tonight
text: tonight : mostly dry with clear spells , but turning cloudier later .
temperatures falling to 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow : a dry and perhaps bright start , but thickening cloud will bring patchy outbreaks of rain .
temperatures reaching up to 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: investigations continue after dead body found in high wycombe
text: detectives say the dead body of a man in high wycombe is yet to be formally identified with investigations continuing as officers look to confirm a cause of death .
author: Bucks Free Press

documents.title: re-appeal to find missing woman from aylesbury
text: thames valley police are re-appealing for the public 's help in finding a missing woman from aylesbury .
it 's more than a month since janet foan , 48 , went missing from the stocklake area .
she has links to aylesbury , wendover , amersham , chesham , reading and sussex and police say they want to check on her welfare .

documents.title: latest headlines : two women guilty of causing baby death better funding needed for beds police
text: the stories we 're looking at this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: baby imran death : women failed to provide child with food , drink or aid
text: two women found guilty of causing the death of a seven-month-old baby in luton will be sentenced next month .
the jury heard how jessica price , 24 , and angela price , 62 , of morris close , had continually neglected baby imran by failing to provide him with enough food , drink , or medical aid .
the baby had lost 17 % of his weight in just nine days and had what doctors described as one of the worst cases of nappy rash they had seen .

documents.title: beds pcc 'encouraged ' by public support
text: bedfordshire 's police and crime commissioner olly martins says he 's encouraged by the number of people signing a petition calling for extra funding for the force .
mr martins is gathering support in luton town centre today , along with senior members of beds police .
he is hoping the strength of feeling of local people will help their cause .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bedfordshire mps defend their votes against abolition of 'tampon tax '
text: two bedfordshire mp 's who voted against the abolition of the `` tampon tax '' have insisted they are in favour of the abolition and will rely on the promised actions of the treasury minister .
author: Bedfordshire on Sunday

documents.title: artist jimmy cauty to unveil 'new bedford ' model
text: anyone who went to banksy 's dismaland over the summer will have encountered artist jimmy cauty 's model village , which showed a dystopian vision of life in bedfordshire .
the huge model portrays a `` devastating mass riot or civil catastrophe that has taken place somewhere in bedfordshire , set in the near future '' .

it is going on show in london from november and will feature an additional section called new bedford rising , `` a paradise where policemen can roam free , living idyllic lives and raising their young in a crime free epoch of law and order , peace , and eternal bliss '' .
author: Richard Haugh
BBC News

documents.title: police patrols continue in burnham after sunday shooting
text: police patrols continue to take place in burnham today after a shooting on sunday , which left two teenagers seriously injured .
four men have been arrested by police on sus of attempted murder .
tvp south bucks
tvp southbucks
# burnhamnhpt reassurance patrols at burnham park today .
# staysafe # allswell # c9257 # c2367

documents.title: better funding 'only way ' to protect bedfordshire policing
text: a senior bedfordshire police officer says better funding is the only way to protect local policing in the county .
assistant chief constable mark collins is in luton today , backing a petition organised by the county 's police and crime commissioner , olly matins .
if they receive enough signatures it will lead to a debate on the issue in westminster .
he says extra funding is the essential for the `` changing landscape of policing '' .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: baby imran death : mother and grandmother told they face jail
text: the mother and grandmother of a baby boy who died of severe dehydration aged just seven-months-old have been found guilty of allowing his death .
jessica price , 24 , and angela price , 62 , of morris close , luton , were convicted by a jury at luton crown court after a four week trial .
both women were granted bail , but told to `` prepare themselves for the inevitable custodial sentence '' by a judge .
there will be a serious case review .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: herts police officer 's bravery award : the story
text: after a 100 miles-per-hour chase down the m1 to edgware , pc christopher kouwenberg chased after one of the occupants of a car , which failed to stop in hertfordshire , as he ran off carrying two guns .
the man fired backwards at least five times .
the pc moved an elderly by-stander out of the line of fire .
when the officers returned to the car they found a man tied up in the back with blood on his jacket .
two men were eventually jailed for kidnap , firearm and drugs offences .

documents.title: the moment a ww2 bomb found in potters bar was detonated
text: hertfordshire police have released a video of the moment a world war two shell found in a potters bar garden was detonated .
two devices were found in the same garden in park avenue ; one on sunday and another on monday .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hertfordshire police officer receives bravery award
text: a hertfordshire policeman who chased a criminal while being shot at has received a police bravery award .
in november 2013 , pc christopher kouwenberg and his colleague sped down the m1 after a car which failed to stop in bricketwood after they found it had an out-of-date mot .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: working together at love luton half marathon
text: signposts , the charity that supports the homeless , led a team of volunteers at the third annual love luton half marathon on sunday .
author: Luton News

documents.title: high wycombe mp speaks about britain and the eu
text: conservative mp for high wycombe , steve baker , has said he does n't support a looser relationship with the european union like some northern european countries have .
`` i believe britain is capable of regaining it 's influence and power in world affairs by leaving the eu '' , said the prominent euro-sceptic .
pm david cameron is heading to iceland to argue against britain adopting such an arrangement .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon headlines : beds pcc encouraged by public watford woman 's letters read to court
text: the headlines this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lost something on the bus ? tweet about it
text: a local bus company is asking passengers who may have lost items during their journey to take to social media first rather than up the phone .
arriva shires says that this year they 've already received over 35,000 calls about lost property , ranging from live ferrets and false teeth to prosthetic limbs .

documents.title: 'more than meets the eye ' to robert mandley case , coroner rules
text: the coroner at an inquest into the death of robert mandley , who is subject to a murder investigation in south africa , said `` there is more to the case than meets the eye '' .
richard hulett said : `` this is very plainly unlawful killing .
in this case , that is the equivalent of murder . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: robert mandley 'unlwfully killed ' , coroner rules
text: a coroner has ruled a buckinghamshire man who is the subject of a murder investigation in south africa was unlawfully killed .
beaconsfield coroners court heard robert mandley was attacked on 19 april and died a day later in hospital after sustaining head and neck injuries .
it 's thought he was killed by two men helping him to move house .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bedfordshire police 'unique ' says assistant chief constable
text: the assistant chief constable of bedfordshire police says the force wants the government to recognise that it is `` unique '' .
`` it 's a shire force , it 's a county force but it has luton , and luton for me is an outer-london borough , '' said assistant chief constable mark collins .
`` we do need some additional funding to sustain what we 're doing ''

documents.title: shahena uddin murder trial : letters described assaults and force-feeding
text: letters written by a woman who was allegedly beaten to death in her watford home describe her being force fed and assaulted .
the letters were read to a jury , with one note from shahena uddin , 19 , begging for help and writing of her `` suffering '' .
miss uddin 's `` severely beaten '' body was found at her leavesden road home last october .
seven of her family members deny charges , including murder and causing or allowing the death of a vulnerable adult .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fuel thefts on the rise in tring
text: residents in tring are being warned by police of an increase in fuel thefts from minis .
berko & tring police
berkopolice
attention all mini owners .
theft of fuel from mini 's is on the increase in tring .
please report any sus activity asap !
attention all mini owners .
theft of fuel from mini 's is on the increase in tring .
please report any sus activity asap !

documents.title: missing 82-year-old may be in hertfordshire
text: a man with vascular dementia who 's been missing from his essex home since sunday may be in hertfordshire , police say .
gordon wilson , 82 , from leaden roding was supposed to meet his daughter for sunday lunch but was not at home when she went to him up .
it 's believed mr wilson took some cash and medication with him and may be trying to travel to glasgow .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beds police 'making best of bad job ' for years , says pcc
text: the police and crime commissioner for bedfordshire has said the force `` has for years been making the best of a bad job '' due to low resources .
olly martins is speaking to luton residents today at the town 's arndale centre about his petition to the government over police funding .
`` if [ resources are ] cut further , that is the point at which the force will start to become unsustainable and that 's a point that i do n't want to reach '' , mr martins said .
author: Neil Bradford
BBC Look East

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : beds police funding meeting man absconds from secure unit in mk
text: the stories we 're looking at this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: how many ww2 bombs never went off ?
text: life is returning to normal in potters bar after two suspected world war two shells were found in a garden .
two devices were discovered in park avenue on sunday , but how many bombs left over from the war are still yet to be found ?
`` the germans dropped 75,000-tonnes of bombs on the uk in world war two and of that between five and 15 % never went off , '' says writer and military historian , dr mark felton .
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: busy morning for beds pcc in luton mall
text: it 's been a busy morning at the mall in luton today for bedfordshire 's police and crime commissioner olly martins .
the commissioner is in the shopping centre to encourage members of the public to sign a petition to the government about a review of the county 's police funding .
author: Neil Bradford
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather : this afternoon will be much drier
text: after a cloudy and wet morning , this afternoon is looking much drier , with some brightness developing by the end of the day .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police use cup of tea comparison to explain consent
text: thames valley police is trying to get the message across that sex without consent is rape by using the comparison of a cup of tea .
it says if someone says no to a cup of tea you should n't force them to drink it - and it 's the same with sex .
det chief insp justin fletcher , said the tea video is `` a really , really simple explanation '' of why people need to get consent .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: men posed as police officers to rob pedestrians in welwyn garden city
text: two men posed as police officers before robbing two other men in welwyn garden city .
the victims were walking along ravensfield road at 12:30 on 10 october when a blue peugeot people carrier pulled up .
two of the three men inside said they were police before demanding to search the victims .
the men , who were smartly dressed and spoke with irish accents , stole cash before driving away .
read descriptions of the men here .

documents.title: herts fire puts halloween costumes to the test
text: it 's something we keep seeing warnings about as halloween approaches - the safety of fancy-dress costumes .
hertfordshire fire and rescue have released a video showing what might happen were a costume to brush past a candle flame
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: excavation unearths rare saxon finds near leighton buzzard
text: pagan burials containing rare pieces of jewellery and other graves goods have been found in a small saxon cemetery near leighton buzzard .
author: Leighton Buzzard Observer

documents.title: 'peace garden ' under way in luton
text: photographs of a `` peace garden '' being created in luton as a symbol of collaboration between christians and muslims in the town , have been released .
one area of the garden at all saints church has already been completed , but an overgrown section is still to be converted into an allotment .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the rain continues : blade the police puppy is enjoying himself
text: to state the obvious , it is very wet outside today .
while we may not be particularly enjoying it , blade the police puppy certainly is .
when do we stop calling him a puppy by the way ?
we 've followed blade 's journey with beds , herts and cambs police dog unit since he was tiny but now he 's looking like a fully-grown dog !
bch police dogs
dogpolicebch
yay , puddles !
dad has got his waterproofs on , wimp .
yay , puddles !
dad has got his waterproofs on , wimp .
@ twitterid @ twitterid excellent photo and perfect day today for puddles !
@ twitterid @ twitterid lovely photo # splashsplash # comeondaditsfun # i'llcomeshakenearyou
@ twitterid brilliant to see such a happy hound !
@ twitterid fantastic photo
@ twitterid great photo !
@ twitterid us hoomans are n't as tough as you
@ twitterid but dad does n't have a built in fur coat ; - )
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal after fatal collision near milton keynes
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a fatal accident near milton keynes yesterday .
a pedestrian died after being hit by a lorry at chicheley on the a509 at 08:50 .
he was taken to milton keynes hospital but later died .

documents.title: heavy rain causes radlett line to flood
text: following heavy rain the radlett train line between elstree and west hampstead is causing delays for services due to flooding .
author: Watford Observer

documents.title: brother of man 'murdered ' in south africa hopes inquest will bring closure
text: the brother of a buckinghamshire man murdered in south africa has said he hopes an inquest , due to be heard today , will bring the family some closure .
robert mandley , 66 , ( far right ) died in april .
it 's thought he was killed by men who were helping him move house .
chris mandley , 59 , from aylesbury , ( second left ) said : `` the police are too busy and the officer in charge of the case wo n't take my calls .
it is very upsetting . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: four held over south buckinghamshire shooting
text: four males are being held by police in connection with a shooting in burnham on sunday , which left two teenage boys injured .
a 24-year-old , 18-year-old and 15-year-old from burnham have been arrested along with an 18-year-old from slough , on sus of attempted murder .
both victims are now recovering from leg and hand injuries sustained in the incident in burnham park .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : fatal collision in mk meeting over bedfordshire police funding
text: the top stories this morning :

documents.title: inquest into death of bucks man 'murdered ' in south africa due to be heard
text: an inquest into the death of a buckinghamshire man who was murdered in south africa is due to be heard at beaconsfield coroner 's court today .
ex-postman robert mandley , 66 , who retired to south africa seven years ago , was killed in april by men who were helping him move house .
the south african police service has confirmed his death is being treated as murder , but his family have criticised the handling of the case .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foreign office continues to seek release of pensioner from iranian prison
text: the foreign office is continuing to seek the release of kamal foroughi from an iranian prison on medical grounds .
mr faroughi , 76 , who holds dual british and iranian citizenship , has served more than half of an eight-year sentence for espionage
a government spokesman said : `` we are very concerned for his health and have raised this with the iranian authorities on repeated occasions . ''
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'unconscious people do n't want tea , ' say police in consent campaign
text: thames valley police has launched a video campaign featuring stick figures making , accepting or rejecting cups of tea to highlight that consent is a simple concept .
as a stick figure rejects the idea of a cuppa , a voiceover says : `` if they say 'no thank you ' then do n't make them tea .
at all .
and if they are unconscious , do n't make them tea .
unconscious people do n't want tea ``
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police warn motorists over heavy rain
text: it 's lashing down here in dunstable this morning - and police in nearby hertfordshire are asking drivers to be careful .
met office yellow rain warning in place for # herts this morning .
pls allow extra time for your journey & drive to the road conditions
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: herts man calls for release of sick father from iranian prison
text: a hertfordshire man whose sick father is serving an eight-year sentence for espionage at evin prison in tehran , is calling for him to be released on compassionate grounds .
kamal faroughi , 76 , who holds dual british and iranian citizenship , denies the charge .
his son kamran ( hertsmere , says the family are begging the iranian authorities to release him .
author: Jessica Cooper
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man absconds from secure unit while on monastery day trip
text: police are hunting for a man who absconded from eaglestone-based medium security unit chadwick lodge in milton keynes while on a day out to a monastery .

malcolm millman , 58 , disappeared during a visit to st margarets in great gaddesden , hemel hempstead , on saturday and was last seen at manchester airport on monday but police do n't believe he has access to a passport .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beds mps to meet with policing minister over county 's funding
text: a meeting is due to take place today between bedfordshire 's mps and policing minister mike penning over funding for the county 's police force .
local politicians are campaigning for a larger police budget , while a petition started by the county 's police and crime commissioner has so far received about 7,000 signatures .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : heavy rain this morning with a weather warning in place
text: this morning will see heavy rain , but sunny spells are expected this afternoon with a top temperature of 14c ( 57f ) .
the met office has issued a yellow warning for rain in parts hertfordshire , cambridgeshire and essex up to 11:00 .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines : herts man calls for release of father from iranian prison beds mps due to meet with policing minister
text: here are the top stories making the news this morning :
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : queues on the m25 following an accident
text: traffic is queuing on the clockwise m25 between j16 for the m40 and j17 for the a412 at maple cross due to an accident which is now on the hard shoulder .
all lanes have been reopened but congestion is back to j14 for the a3113 at heathrow .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the three counties until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch about anything , you can email , tweet or head over to our facebook page .
coming up - wednesday 's news headlines and weather .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
